citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the Licensee could not locate the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) that is required
under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) when an exhibitor employs a part-time Attending Veterinarian. As a result, the
written PVC could not be reviewed during the inspection.
Per this Section, all documents that are required to be kept under the AWA should be available at the time of an
inspection so the required documents can be reviewed to determine compliance with the provisions of the AWA. Failure to
provide documents and records prevents APHIS officials from verifying compliance with the provisions of the AWA.
Copies of all documents and records required under the AWA must be on the premises and available for review. Correct
by September 24, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
